uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class CSVReader

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.CSVReader

public class CSVReader
extends java.lang.Object

CSVReader Read a CSV file. This can be from a file or a web address. In the simplest form a CSV file consists of a series of lines, each cell of which is separated by a comma. To include a comma in a cell, the cell must be in quotes. If the cell contains a quote, then the cell must be in quotes, and each quote to include in the cell appears twice.

Calling the constructor causes the file to be read in. The data can then be accessed by asking for the Table. Class methods are available to allow CSV formatted data to be parsed on behalf of the caller.

Author:
Gary Polhill

                 CSVException
Constructor, reading in all the data in the CSV file.

Parameters:
filename - The file from which to read the CSV data. If this begins with http:// or https://, then it is assumed the file is to be downloaded from the web.

getTable

getHeadedTable

public HeadedTable<java.lang.String> getHeadedTable()
This method will throw an IllegalStateException if the number of column headings is different from the maximum number of columns found in any one row.

Returns:
A table with headings from the data read in.

tokenize

public static java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> tokenize(java.lang.String line)
Convert a line of CSV text into a series of tokens. Each token is one of:
  • A comma
  • A double quote
  • A string of text not containing one of the above

Parameters:
line - The line of text to tokenize.
Returns:
A list of CSV tokens in the line.

parseCells

private static void parseCells(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                               java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> row)
                        throws CSVException
Private entry method into recursive parsing of a line of CSV text, which calls the main method.

Parameters:
tokens - A list of tokens in the line
row - A list of cells in the row so far (empty when called)
Throws:
CSVException

parseCells

private static void parseCells(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                               java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> row,
                               java.lang.StringBuffer cell)
                        throws CSVException
Main private method for recursively parsing a line of CSV text.

Parameters:
tokens - A list of the remaining tokens in the line
row - The row of cells being built up from the tokens in the line
cell - The current cell being built up from the tokens (empty when first called)
Throws:
CSVException

parseQuotedCell

private static void parseQuotedCell(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> tokens,
                                    java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> row,
                                    java.lang.StringBuffer cell)
                             throws CSVException
Partner of the main private recursive CSV parsing method to parse a cell in quotes. The first quote in the cell is assumed to have been read. This method will keep going until it finds the closing quote, which is followed either by a comma or the end of the line. If this is not found, an exception is raised.

Parameters:
tokens - A list of tokens on the current line of text
row - The row of cells so far found
cell - The contents of the current cell.
Throws:
CSVException
